* The main CharSiew chatbot application class.
* Handles initialization, user interaction, and the main program loop.
/** Handles file storage and retrieval of tasks. */
/** Stores the current list of tasks. */
/** Handles all interactions with the user. */
* Constructs a CharSiew instance with a given storage file path.
* Loads tasks from storage or initializes an empty TaskList if loading fails.
* @param filePath Path to the file storing tasks.
ui.showError("Failed to load Char Siew from file");
* Starts the CharSiew program and runs the main input loop.
* Reads user commands from the console, parses them, executes them,
* and handles any exceptions that occur.
* The main entry point for the CharSiew application.
* Represents the command to exit the CharSiew application.
* When executed, it shows a farewell message and signals the program to terminate.
* Executes the Bye command by displaying a farewell message.
* @param tasks   The TaskList (unused in this command).
* @param ui      The UI object to show messages.
* @param storage The Storage object (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Signals that this command exits the program.
* @return true, indicating that the program should terminate.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all tasks.
* @param storage The Storage for saving/loading tasks.
* @throws Exception If something goes wrong during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception;
* Returns true if this command exits the program.
* Represents a command to add a Deadline task.
* Handles creation, addition to the task list, saving, and UI display.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with a description and due date.
* @param by The due date of the task.
* Parses user input to create a DeadlineCommand.
* @param input Raw input string after the "deadline" keyword.
* Executes the command: adds the Deadline task to the TaskList,
* saves the updated list, and displays the task addition via UI.
* @param tasks TaskList to add the task to.
* @param ui UI object for displaying messages.
* @param storage Storage object for saving the task list.
* @throws IOException If saving to storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to delete a task from the TaskList.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the 1-based index of the task to delete
* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the given index
* from the TaskList, saving the updated list, and showing a confirmation message.
* @param tasks   The TaskList from which a task will be removed.
* @param ui      The UI object to show messages.
* @param storage The Storage object to save changes.
* @throws IOException if saving the updated TaskList fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to add an Event task to the TaskList.
* Constructs an EventCommand with the specified description and dates.
* @param from        Start date of the event.
* @param to          End date of the event.
public EventCommand(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Creates an EventCommand from a user input string.
* @return an EventCommand with parsed description and dates
* Executes the command by creating a new Event, adding it to the TaskList,
* saving the updated list, and showing a confirmation message.
* @param tasks   The TaskList to add the event to.
* @param ui      The UI object to show messages.
* @param storage The Storage object to save changes.
* @throws IOException if saving the TaskList fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
Task t = new Event(description, from, to);
* Represents a command that finds and lists all tasks
* whose descriptions contain the specified keyword.
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the given search keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in the task list
* Executes the find command by searching the task list for tasks
* containing the keyword, then displaying the results.
* @param ui      the user interface for displaying results
* @param storage the storage used to save tasks (not modified by this command)
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs when accessing storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to display all tasks in the TaskList.
* Executes the command by displaying all tasks using the UI.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The UI object used to display the tasks.
* @param storage The Storage object (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the TaskList.
* Constructs a MarkCommand for a specific task index.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks the specified task as done, saves the updated TaskList,
* and informs the user via the UI.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all tasks.
* @param ui      The UI object used to display messages.
* @param storage The Storage object used to persist the TaskList.
* @throws IOException If saving to storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to add a Todo task to the TaskList.
* Constructs a TodoCommand with the given task description.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* Creates a new Todo task, adds it to the TaskList, saves the list,
* and informs the user via the UI.
* @param tasks   The TaskList to add the new Todo to.
* @param ui      The UI object used to display messages.
* @param storage The Storage object used to persist the TaskList.
* @throws IOException If saving to storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done in the TaskList.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the given task index.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to unmark.
* Marks the task at the given index as not done, saves the TaskList,
* and informs the user via the UI.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing the task.
* @param ui      The UI object used to display messages.
* @param storage The Storage object used to persist the TaskList.
* @throws IOException If saving to storage fails.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws IOException {
* Parses user input into corresponding Command objects.
* Acts as the bridge between raw user input and command execution.
* Parses a raw input string and returns the appropriate Command.
* @param input Raw string entered by the user.
* @return A Command object corresponding to the input.
* @throws Exception If the input cannot be parsed into a valid command.
public static Command parse(String input) throws Exception {
throw new Exception("I'm not too sure what that means...");
* Handles reading from and writing to the storage file.
* Provides methods to load tasks from file into a TaskList and save tasks back to the file.
* Constructs a Storage object with the given file path.
* @param filePath Path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* If the file/folder doesn't exist, returns an empty TaskList.
* @throws IOException If there is an error reading the file.
* Saves tasks from the TaskList into the storage file.
* @throws IOException If there is an error writing to the file.
public void save(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Parses a line of text from the file into a Task object.
* @param line Line of text from file.
* @return Task object corresponding to the line, or null if the line is corrupted.
Event event = new Event(name, from, to);
* Converts a Task object into a line of text for saving to file.
* @return String representing the task in file format.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A Deadline has a description (name) and a due date.
/** The due date of the deadline task. */
* Constructs a Deadline task with a name and a due date.
* @param name The description of the task.
* @param by The due date of the task (expects format yyyy-MM-dd).
* Returns the due date of this deadline task.
* @return The due date as a LocalDate object.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task,
* including its type, completion status, name, and formatted due date.
* @return String representation of the deadline task.
* Represents an event task that occurs over a period of time.
* An Event has a description (name), a start date, and an end date.
/** The start date of the event. */
/** The end date of the event. */
* Constructs an Event task with a name, start date, and end date.
* @param name The description of the event.
* @param from The start date of the event.
* @param to The end date of the event.
public Event(String name, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Returns the start date of the event.
* @return The start date as a LocalDate object.
* Returns the end date of the event.
* @return The end date as a LocalDate object.
* Returns a string representation of the event task,
* including its type, completion status, name, and formatted start and end dates.
* @return String representation of the event task.
* Represents a generic task with a name and completion status.
/** Indicates whether the task is completed. */
* Constructs a Task with the specified name.
* The task is initially not done.
* @param name The description of the task.
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return The status icon as a String.
* Returns whether the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise.
* Returns the name/description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task,
* including its completion status and name.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides operations to manage them.
* Constructs a TaskList with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the given index.
* Removes the task at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to remove.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Returns the internal list of tasks.
* Finds all tasks whose description contains the given keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for
* @return a {@code TaskList} containing all matching tasks
* Represents a Todo task with only a name and completion status.
* Constructs a Todo task with the given name.
* @param name The description of the todo task.
* Returns the string representation of the Todo task.
* @return A string in the format "[T][status] name".
* Handles all interactions with the user.
* Responsible for reading user input and displaying messages.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays a welcome message and lists available commands.
System.out.println(" Hey there! I'm Char Siew, the chatbot your mom wishes you were.");
System.out.println(" What can I do for you today?");
System.out.println(" - todo task_name                          add a new todo task");
System.out.println(" - deadline task_name /by yyyy-mm-dd       add a new deadline");
System.out.println(" - event /from yyyy-mm-dd /to yyyy-mm-dd   add a new event");
System.out.println(" - mark task_index                         mark the task done");
System.out.println(" - unmark task_index                       mark the task undone");
System.out.println(" - delete task_index                       delete the task");
System.out.println(" See you soon! May your life be less roasted than me. ");
* Reads a line of input from the user.
* @return the user input as a String
/** Prints a horizontal line separator for UI clarity. */
* Displays a message when a task is added.
* @param t the task that was added
* @param count the total number of tasks after addition
public void showAddedTask(Task t, int count) {
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + count + " tasks in the plate.");
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task the task that was marked
System.out.println(" Nice! Treat yourself with more Char Siew :)");
* Displays a message when a task is unmarked.
* @param task the task that was unmarked
System.out.println(" Noted! Energise yourself with more Char Siew ;)");
* Displays a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task the task that was deleted
* @param taskLeft the number of remaining tasks
public void showDelete(Task task, int taskLeft) {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + taskLeft + " tasks in the plate.");
